1.text: Do you live in an university housing

2.text: E-kot members could help you. Contact them <contact>here</contact> !

3.text: Before going further, turn off Wi-Fi on your computer and make sure your ethernet cable is correctly plugged on both sides (in the computer and in your rooter)

4.text: Can you browse to this page kotserv.unamur.be ?

5.text: Have you already registered your computer on this page ?

6.text: Is your quota over the limit ? You can check it out on kotserv.unamur.be/users

7.text:
Please register your computer on kotserv. Be careful to enter the correct credentials, which means, your eID (not your e-mail adress !) and the corresponding password. Than, reboot your computer. On the restart, internet should work..
For more information, click here

9.text: Are there several connected devices when you only use one ?

10.text: You probably have a torrent client issue. <contact>Contact E-kot</contact> for an intervention.

11.text: You probably have borrowed someone's eID or let someone use yours. <contact>Contact E-kot</contact> to delete the device(s) that doesn't belong to you

12.text: Your computer is probably incorrectly configured. <contact>Contact E-kot</contact> for an intervention.

13.text: Please, try with an other ethernet cable. If you don't have an other one, you can get one from <contact>E-kot</contact> for 3â‚¬.

answers.text: I tried with an other cable, I can continue the registration of my computer on the university network.

14.text: Please, try with an other wall plug in your housing.

answers.text: I tied with an other wall plug and it worked.
